title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4038.4 - Sale, transfer restricted
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4038.4 - Sale, transfer restricted

State Regulations

If a horse is claimed the horse shall not be sold or
transferred to anyone i wholly or in part, except in a claiming race, for a
period of 30 days from the date of the claim. A claimed horse shall not, unless
reclaimed, remain i in the same stable or under the control or management of
its former owner or trainer for a like period. A claimed horse shall not race
outside New York State for a period of 60 days from the date of the claim or
the end of the meeting at which such horse was claimed, whichever period of
time is longer, except that a horse may run: (a) in a sweepstakes elsewhere for which the
horse was nominated by its former owner or trainer; (b) after a period of 30 days from the end of
a Finger Lakes racing season, if the horse had been claimed at Finger Lakes
racetrack; or
(c) if permission is
granted by the stewards. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
